column1: 2	2	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-clinton-foundation-factb-idUSKCN110264	Factbox: Why the Clinton Foundation draws both praise and criticism	"
Since announcing her presidential bid last year
column2: Hillary Clinton has had to field questions about the Bill
column3: Hillary & Chelsea Clinton Foundation
column4: her family's global philanthropy. The non-profit group has been praised by health experts for helping to negotiate lower prices for HIV medicine in the developing world. But ethics experts and Clinton's Republican opponents say its reliance on millions of dollars from foreign governments and powerful businesses makes her vulnerable to charges her donors could expect favorable treatment from the White House
column5: which her campaign says is unfounded.* THE FOUNDATION'S HISTORYBill Clinton established the Clinton Foundation in 1997 to raise funds for his presidential archive in Little Rock
column7: as he prepared to leave the White House. It has since grown into a complex global philanthropic organization
column8: working to improve health and prospects in dozens of countries and to fight climate change.After leaving her job as U.S. secretary the state in 2013
column9: Hillary Clinton joined the foundation's board
column10: and the organization was renamed the Bill
column11: Hillary & Chelsea Clinton Foundation. Later in 2015
column12: Hillary Clinton left the foundation to run for president and in the August 2016 her husband said he will step down from the board if she wins. Their plans to remain with the foundation.* THE FOUNDATION'S WORKThe foundation typically raises more than a quarter of a billion dollars each year in grants and donations. It spends about $200 million each year on programs and other expenses.

column1: The biggest program is the Clinton Health Access Initiative
column2: which accounts for about two-thirds of the foundation's annual expenses and focuses on reducing the cost and increasing the availability of medicine for HIV
column3: malaria and other infections in developing countries. The foundation also is involved in an array of other causes. It helps farmers in Africa increase yields and profits and tries to stop poachers from killing elephants there. It encourages American parents to read to their toddlers and schools to provide healthier environments for their students. It also helps Americans get access to loans to make their homes more energy efficient.Under the name Clinton Global Initiative
column4: the foundation throws regular glitzy multi-day gatherings where people from politics
column5: corporations and non-profit organizations to discuss philanthropy projects. CGI will hold its last such meeting in September before ending.

column1: *CRITICISMS OF FOUNDATION

column2: foundation officials admitted the charity breached an ethics agreement Clinton signed with the White House in order to become secretary of state. Under the agreement
column3: she promised she would annually disclose the names of all donors to the charity and that it would seek State Department approval before accepting new money from foreign governments. The charities said not complying with the promises was a result of oversights.

column1: The foundation also admitted it had wrongly completed half a dozen annual tax returns that gave misleading figures about the amount of support it got from foreign governments
column2: among other errors. After Reuters discovered the errors
column3: the foundation apologized and refiled the returns.The foundation continued to accept money from foreigners
column4: including foreign governments
column5: and corporations while Clinton was secretary of state but has said it will introduce at least some limits on such donations if she becomes president. Emails by Clinton and her staff released by the State Department show it was not unusual for foundation officials to help donors get access to Clinton
column6: prompting experts in government ethics to raise concerns that the foundation gives rise to an appearance of a conflict of interest. Donald Trump
column7: Clinton's Republican rival for the presidency
column8: has called for a special prosecutor to look into the foundation. Clinton's campaign says any donor who expected special favors from Clinton in return would have been disappointed. (Reporting by Jonathan Allen; Editing by Bill Trott)"	['Clinton']	[]

column1: 3	3	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-court-immigration-idUSKCN11023N	Lawsuit opens new front in Obama immigration legal fight	"
By Lawrence Hurley
| WASHINGTON

WASHINGTON Immigration advocates on Thursday mounted a long-shot effort to revive part of U.S. President Barack Obama's plan to shield millions of immigrants from deportation by filing a lawsuit challenging the national scope of a court order that blocked it.With favorable court rulings
column2: the lawyers filing the lawsuit say it has the long-term potential to unravel decisions that blocked Obama's November 2014 plan nationwide. The White House program
column3: if it had been fully implemented
column4: could have allowed up to four million people with no legal immigration status to obtain work authorization.The lawsuit was filed in federal court in New York on behalf of Martin Batalla Vidal
column6: an immigrant from Mexico who has lived in the United States since he was seven and has benefited from the program.

column1: He initially received a three-year work authorization
column2: which has now been revoked due to a Texas judge's ruling in February 2015 that blocked Obama's plan. Texas and 25 other states had challenged it.Vidal would still be eligible for a two-year work authorization under an earlier program
column3: which has not been challenged and was not covered by the injunction.

column1: Vidal's lawyers at the National Immigration Law Center say that if he wins
column2: the ruling could have broad implications because it could help to eventually reinstate Obama's program for up to 60 percent of potential applicants in parts of the country not covered by the Texas ruling. The Texas judge's ruling was upheld on appeal. On June 23
column3: the Supreme Court deadlocked 4-4 on the case
column4: leaving the appeals court decision in place.

column1: The court is currently one justice short following the death of Justice Antonin Scalia in February. The Supreme Court is currently considering whether to rehear the case once it has a full complement of justices. (Reporting by Lawrence Hurley; Editing by Alistair Bell)"	['Lawrence']	[]
